Helops corallipes Reitter 1902: 219

subSubSection.paragraph: Bibliography and synonymy are given in

Type Material.
Faldermann’ s types are probably lost. The types of
C. flavipes
are deposited in MNHP. The species was described based on specimens collected by Hans Leder from Tsalka (southern of Georgia , see Material Examined). I studied
Cylindrinotus
from Tsalka and found that it is only a form of
C. gibbicollis
with reddish legs. Reitter (1902) also described
var. corallipes
from the same locality.

Distribution. Armenia (excluding southern part of the country), southern Georgia , eastern Turkey .
Bionomics. The species inhabits wet alpine zones in high mountains from 2,000 to 2,700 m . One population is known near Tbilisi (about 700 m ).
